BitTorrent

Class Peer

  • java.lang.Object
    • BitTorrent.Peer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Peer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class creates a peer thread for peers we are connected to for upload an download.
    Author:
    Amulya Uppala, Truong Pham, Jewel Lim

                   int index,
                   int begin)
            throws java.io.IOException

        Parameters:

      • requestPiece

        public void requestPiece()
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.InterruptedException
        Request the piece from the peer by looping through the array of things we don't have and the things they have. then we can create the message and send it to them.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • sendInterested

        public void sendInterested()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Sends interested message to send to peer so that we can get unchoked.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • openConnection

        public boolean openConnection()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Handshake and make sure correct responses. then send the bitfield we have.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getBitField

        public void getBitField(byte read)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Get bitfield from peer. If wrong bit field size make bitfield null
        Parameters:
        read - message ID
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readMsg

        public byte readMsg()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Read in message from peer which are formatted based on message type. We need id of the message to identify what type of message was sent. Handles messages by calling methods based on message
        Returns:
        message byte as int is returned
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • gotChoked

        public void gotChoked()
               throws java.net.SocketException
        Deals with choking if peer chokes us. It waits till we get unchoked or will terminate.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException

      • toBooleanArray

        public static boolean[] toBooleanArray(byte[] B)
        Converts bitfield byte array to boolean array
        Parameters:
        B - bitfield array to convert to boolean array
        Returns:
        boolean array

      • Determinechoke

        public boolean Determinechoke()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Determine which if peer is to be choked or unchoked.
        Returns:
        returns true if peer is unchoked, or returns true if peer is choked
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        closes the socket and streams.
